text:
Hello, I'm looking for a development team to develop a project on HubSpot.
Here is a short description...
Developing a platform to manage Leads, Deals, Companies, and Partners.
Using HubSpot as a CRM and adding an additional entity (that is missing right now).
Build a front-end interface for the partners. And sync everything using HubSpot API.
Enable the partners to view companies, rate them, and assign new leads to these companies.
Enable the partners to see statistics on the previous rating
Enable the admin to publish news for the partners from the backend platform
Enable the admin to filter and view companies, leads, and deals  based on different categories (most of the options are built-in in HubSpot)

I'm looking for a company I can work with to complete this task.
Building the front-end
Syncing the front-end with HubSpot using an API
Complete the project
Help with understanding the pricing for the HubSpot licences

Hi, How can you add a input field with a submit button on the right panel of a object?
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview#sales-object-properties>

I only see iframe, but i want a input field and submit button.
Extra information:
Its via a HubSpot APP -> CRM cards -> Card properties

current code card with iframe:
```{"totalCount":1,"topLevelActions":{"settings":{"type":"IFRAME","width":640,"height":480,"url":"<https://example.com/iframe-contents>","label":"Edit","propertyNamesIncluded":["some_crm_property"],"type":"String"},"primary":{"type":"IFRAME","width":640,"height":480,"url":"<https://example.com/primary-iframe>","label":"test_label_primary","propertyNamesIncluded":[],"type":"IFRAME"},"secondary":[{"type":"IFRAME","width":640,"height":480,"url":"<https://example.com/secondary-iframe>","label":"test_label_secondary","propertyNamesIncluded":[],"type":"IFRAME"}]},"responseVersion":"v3"}```
I work for a HubSpot agency, I can share more details if you wish.
Hi everyone

with the HubSpot api, how can I fetch the conversations of a contact (threads), using this endpoint <https://api.hubapi.com/conversations/v3/conversations/threads>, how can I filter it by the associated contact associatedContactId

Hey all, I'm working with a wordpress site that is using the HubSpot api. There is a form which asks for a user to sign up with an email and password along with other fields. I'm looking to leverage the `identify` function to create a Contact on HubSpot which is made with the current call to my app to create a user. One thing I should mention is that I dont have access to the wordpress site code so I'm trying to run JS snippets on the wordpress site in the dev console.
First I execute:
```hq= _hsq.push(["identify",{
    email: '<mailto:cobiTEST@testjs.com|cobiTEST@testjs.com>',
    firstname: 'Cobi',
    lastname: 'TESTER',
    leadsource: 'IC Email Buiilder Demo',
    ic_email_buiilder_demo: 'true',
    phone: '+1123123123',
    jobtitle: 'CEO',
    company: 'CM Dev Team Testers'
}]); ```
Then I execute a track event so the data is passed to HubSpot
```_hsq.push(['trackPageView']);```
The problem I'm running into is that no call is being made to HubSpot to make a new Contact record. Any advice?
Is the HubSpot tracking code installed on the wordpress site?
It is, we're using tracking on other pages
If you open the network tab of the developer console after executing the push function does anything network activity pop up?
Nothing :disappointed:
and yeah no activity on the network tab after execution
I can’t get it to do anything either … humm
nvm I forgot to send the trackPageView event
You got it to work??
yeah, what happens if you type `_hsq.push` into the console?
The function is recognized
can you expand it

Hey guys, our api pull scripts are pulling different amounts of data from the HubSpot api when running it twice, once after the other. Is there currently anything broken in the api that anyone is aware of?
try removing `hq=` when you do the call from your code pasted above
woops that was an old function call, I dont use the `hq=` anymore
Why do you want to send it to HS? My initial thought is using GA4 for event tracking…
So I can detonate emails or other activities that the user has!
would you mind dm’ing me the page you are trying to do this from? I’m running out of ideas
does `ic_email_buiilder_demo` actually have two `i`’s?
in `buiilder`
I see. GA4 is for anonymous statistics. I have no answer for your need, as there is no HubSpot SDK I have heard of.
it does. There was a typo made on the property by the person setting it up
DMing you now!
<@U05BABASY8N> what API endpoint are you hitting?

<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/objects/companies>
and
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/objects/contacts>

I just tested on my end and with not parameters, I’m getting the exact same 10.

Are you pulling via the SDK or direct API calls?
I'm pulling via an api with a python script, and has been running for months without issue and suddenly over the weekend its only pulling partial files
that seems like a timeout or maybe the limit on the data coming back?
I doubt it, the pull shouldnt be anywhere near the limit, and the error handling isnt popping up with anything of that sort
did you add properties to the request?
We've added several in the last few weeks,  I checked that the added ones were correct with the hs internal names though
also shouldnt that outright break the script if they were causing as issue?
So my initial thoughts were something to do with caching and properties in the request URL.
Just thinking out loud.
Hmmm, I'll have to poke around with that and see if I can find something. Thanks for the thoughts!
Trying to use the crm to find custom objects by the filter “Associated records” “contains” “Company” “<id>” but keep getting a 400 error

If I go through the company record and click “view associated <my custom objects>” along the right side, the filter works fine, it only bugs out when I try to manually select a company when setting the filter.
